prayers.name: Sign of the Cross
prayers.text:
In the name of the Father,
 and of the Son,
and of the Holy Spirit,
Amen.

prayers.name: Sign of the Cross
prayers.text:
In nomine Patris,
et Filii,
et Spiritus Sancti.
Amen.

prayers.name: Apostles' Creed
prayers.text:
I believe in God, the Father almighty,
Creator of heaven and earth,
and in Jesus Christ, his only Son, our Lord,
who was conceived by the Holy Spirit,
born of the Virgin Mary,
suffered under Pontius Pilate,
was crucified, died and was buried;
he descended into hell;
on the third day he rose again from the dead;
he ascended into heaven,
and is seated at the right hand of God the Father almighty;
from there he will come to judge the living and the dead.

I believe in the Holy Spirit,
the holy catholic Church,
the communion of saints,
the forgiveness of sins,
the resurrection of the body,
and life everlasting.
Amen.

prayers.name: Apostles' Creed
prayers.text:
Credo in Deum, Patrem omnipotentem,
Creatorem caeli et terrae,
et in Iesum Christum, Filium eius unicum, Dominum nostrum,
qui conceptus est de Spiritu Sancto,
natus ex Maria Virgine,
passus sub Pontio Pilato,
crucifixus, mortuus et sepultus;
descendit ad inferos;
tertia die resurrexit a mortuis;
ascendit ad caelos,
sedet ad dexteram Dei Patris omnipotentis;
inde venturus est iudicare vivos et mortuos.

Credo in Spiritum Sanctum,
sanctam Ecclesiam catholicam,
sanctorum communionem,
remissionem peccatorum,
carnis resurrectionem,
vitam aeternam.
Amen.

prayers.name: Our Father
prayers.text:
Our Father who art in heaven,
hallowed be thy name.
Thy kingdom come.
Thy will be done 
on earth, as it is in heaven.
Give us this day 
our daily bread,
and forgive us our trespasses, 
as we forgive those who trespass against us,
and lead us not into temptation,
but deliver us from evil.

prayers.name: Our Father
prayers.text:
Pater noster, qui es in caelis,
sanctificetur nomen tuum.
Adveniat regnum tuum.
Fiat voluntas tua,
sicut in caelo, et in terra.

Panem nostrum quotidianum da nobis hodie,
et dimitte nobis debita nostra,
sicut et nos dimittimus debitoribus nostris.
Et ne nos inducas in tentationem,
sed libera nos a malo.
Amen.

prayers.name: Hail Mary
prayers.text:
Hail, Mary, full of grace,
the Lord is with thee.
Blessed art thou amongst women
and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus.
Holy Mary, Mother of God,
pray for us sinners,
now and at the hour of our death.
Amen.

prayers.name: Hail Mary
prayers.text:
Ave Maria, gratia plena,
Dominus tecum.
Benedicta tu in mulieribus,
et benedictus fructus ventris tui, Iesus.

Sancta Maria, Mater Dei,
ora pro nobis peccatoribus,
nunc et in hora mortis nostrae.
Amen.

prayers.name: Glory Be
prayers.text:
Glory be to the Father
and to the Son
and to the Holy Spirit,
as it was in the beginning
is now, and ever shall be
world without end.
Amen.

prayers.name: Glory Be
prayers.text:
Gloria Patri, et Filio, et Spiritui Sancto,
sicut erat in principio, et nunc, et semper,
et in saecula saeculorum.
Amen.

prayers.name: Fatima Prayer
prayers.text:
O My Jesus,
forgive us our sins,
save us from the fires of hell,
lead all souls to Heaven,
especially those in most need of Thy mercy.
Amen

prayers.name: Fatima Prayer
prayers.text:
Domine Iesu, dimitte nobis debita nostra,
libera nos ab igne inferni,
conduc in caelum omnes animas,
praesertim eas, quae maxime indigent misericordia tua.
Amen.

prayers.name: Hail Holy Queen
prayers.text:
Hail, Holy Queen, Mother of Mercy, 
our life, our sweetness and our hope.
To you do we cry,
poor, banished children of Eve. 
To you do we send up our sighs, 
mourning and weeping in this valley of tears 
Turn then, most gracious advocate,
your eyes of mercy toward us,
and after this exile
show unto us the blessed fruit of thy womb,
Jesus.
O clement, O loving, 
O sweet Virgin Mary.

prayers.name: Hail Holy Queen
prayers.text:
Salve, Regina, mater misericordiæ,
vita, dulcedo et spes nostra, salve.
Ad te clamamus,
exsules, filiæ Hevæ.
Ad te suspiramus, gementes et flentes
in hac lacrimarum valle.
Eia ergo, Advocata nostra,
illos tuos misericordes oculos ad nos converte.
Et Iesum, benedictum fructum ventris tui,
nobis post hoc exsilium ostende.
O clemens, O pia, O dulcis Virgo Maria.

prayers.name: St. Michael Prayer
prayers.text:
Saint Michael Archangel, defend us in battle,
be our protection against the wickedness and snares of the devil;
may God rebuke him, we humbly pray; and do thou,
O Prince of the heavenly host, by the power of God,
cast into hell Satan and all the evil spirits who prowl through the world
seeking the ruin of souls.
Amen.

prayers.name: St. Michael Prayer
prayers.text:
Sancte Michael Archangele,
defende nos in proelio;
contra nequitiam et insidias diaboli esto praesidium.
Imperet illi Deus, supplices deprecamur:
tuque, Princeps militiae caelestis,
Satanam aliosque spiritus malignos,
qui ad perditionem animarum pervagantur in mundo,
divina virtute, in infernum detrude.
Amen.

prayers.name: St. Faustina's Prayer for Sinners
prayers.text:
O Jesus, eternal Truth, our Life, I call upon You and I beg Your mercy for poor sinners. 
O sweetest Heart of my Lord, full of pity and unfathomable mercy, I plead with You for poor sinners. 
O Most Sacred Heart, Fount of Mercy from which gush forth rays of inconceivable graces upon the entire human race, 
I beg of You light for poor sinners. 
O Jesus, be mindful of Your own bitter Passion and do not permit the loss of souls redeemed at so dear a price of Your most precious Blood. 
O Jesus, when I consider the great price of Your Blood, I rejoice at its immensity, for one drop alone would have been enough for the salvation of all sinners. 
Although sin is an abyss of wickedness and ingratitude, the price paid for us can never be equalled. 
Therefore, let every soul trust in the Passion of the Lord, and place its hope in His mercy. 
God will not deny His mercy to anyone. 
Heaven and earth may change, but God's mercy will never be exhausted. 
Oh, what immense joy burns in my heart when I contemplate Your incomprehensible goodness, O Jesus! 
I desire to bring all sinners to Your feet that they may glorify Your mercy throughout endless ages.

prayers.name: St. Faustina's Prayer for Sinners
prayers.text:
O Iesu, aeterna Veritas, Vita nostra, invoco Te et misericordiam tuam obsecro pro miseris peccatoribus. 
O dulcissimum Cor Domini mei, plena pietatis et misericordiae immensae, obsecro Te pro miseris peccatoribus. 
O Sacratissimum Cor, Fons Misericordiae, ex quo manant radii gratiae incomprehensibilis super omne genus humanum, 
oro Te, da lucem peccatoribus. 
O Iesu, memor esto passionis Tuae amarae et ne sinas perire animas redemptas tam pretioso sanguine Tuo. 
O Iesu, dum considero immensum pretium Sanguinis Tui, laetor in eius immensitate, nam una gutta sufficeret ad salutem omnium peccatorum. 
Etsi peccatum abyssus est nequitiae et ingratitudinis, pretium pro nobis datum numquam aequabitur. 
Ergo, omnis anima confidat in Passione Domini et spem suam in misericordia Eius ponat. 
Deus nemini misericordiam suam negabit. 
Caelum et terra mutari possunt, sed misericordia Dei numquam exhaurietur. 
O, quanta gaudia in corde meo ardeant dum benignitatem tuam incomprehensibilem considero, O Iesu! 
Cupio omnes peccatores ad pedes Tuos adducere, ut misericordiam tuam glorificent per saecula saeculorum.

prayers.name: Divine Mercy, Opening Prayer
prayers.text:
You expired, Jesus, but the source of life gushed forth for souls, 
and the ocean of mercy opened up for the whole world. 
O Fount of Life, unfathomable Divine Mercy, 
envelop the whole world and empty Yourself out upon us.

prayers.name: Divine Mercy, Opening Prayer
prayers.text:
Expirasti, Iesu, sed fons vitae pro animabus erupit, 
et oceanus misericordiæ pro toto mundo aperuit se. 
O fons vitæ, incomprehensibilis misericordia divina, 
involve mundum universum et effunde te in nos.

prayers.name: O Blood and Water
prayers.text:
O Blood and Water, which gushed forth from the Heart of Jesus 
as a fountain of Mercy for us, I trust in You!

prayers.name: O Blood and Water
prayers.text:
O Sanguis et Aqua, quae ex corde Iesu 
in fontem misericordiae pro nobis emanaverunt, 
in Te confido!

prayers.name: Eternal Father
prayers.text:
Eternal Father, I offer You the Body and Blood, Soul and Divinity 
of Your dearly beloved Son, Our Lord Jesus Christ, 
in atonement for our sins and those of the whole world.

prayers.name: Eternal Father
prayers.text:
Pater aeternæ, offero Tibi Corpus et Sanguinem, Animam et Divinitatem 
dilectissimi Filii Tui, Domini nostri Iesu Christi, 
pro peccatis nostris et totius mundi.

prayers.name: For the Sake of His Sorrowful Passion
prayers.text:
For the sake of His sorrowful Passion, 
have mercy on us and on the whole world.

prayers.name: For the Sake of His Sorrowful Passion
prayers.text:
Propter dolorem passionis eius, 
miserere nobis et totius mundi.

prayers.name: Holy God (Trisagion)
prayers.text:
Holy God, Holy Mighty One, Holy Immortal One, 
have mercy on us and on the whole world.

prayers.name: Holy God (Trisagion)
prayers.text:
Sanctus Deus, Sanctus Fortis, Sanctus Immortalis, 
miserere nobis et totius mundi.

prayers.name: Divine Mercy, Closing Prayer
prayers.text:
Eternal God, in whom mercy is endless and the treasury of compassion inexhaustible, 
look kindly upon us and increase Your mercy in us, 
that in difficult moments we might not despair nor become despondent, 
but with great confidence submit ourselves to Your holy will, 
which is Love and Mercy itself.

prayers.name: Divine Mercy, Closing Prayer
prayers.text:
Deus aeternæ, in quo misericordia infinita est et thesaurus pietatis inexhaustus, 
respice propitius nos et auge in nobis misericordiam tuam, 
ut in momentis difficilibus non deficiamus neque desperemus, 
sed cum magna fiducia nosmetipsos submittamus sanctissimae voluntati tuae, 
quae est Amor et Misericordia ipsa.
